title: Girl, 16, struck by bullet fragments after gunshot at apartment complex
content:
JACKSON, MI - A 16-year-old girl was injured by bullet fragments after a man fired a single shot from a handgun outside an apartment complex Sunday.
Officers were dispatched to a report of a possible shooting at 6:29 p.m., July 31 in the 300 block of Moorman Drive, said Jackson Police Deputy Chief Elmer Hitt.
Police learned from witness statements that a 30-year-old man fired a single shot from a hand gun outside the apartment complex in an unknown direction, possibly the ground, and fragments from the bullet struck the 16-year-old girl in the leg while she was standing outside, Hitt said.
The injured teen told police she's never had a problem with the man who fired the weapon. She heard some men talking about a gun, heard a gunshot and then felt a sharp pain in her leg, Hitt said.
It is unclear what exactly happened that led up to a gun being fired and it very well could have been fired accidentally, Hitt said.
The man fled the scene prior to police arrival and has still not been located, Hitt said.
The teen was transported to Henry Ford Alliance Health to be treated for minor injuries and is still undergoing treatment, Hitt said.
